results.title: Inja
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Joanne Weatherstone and Steven Pasvolsky
results.brief_description: Set initially in apartheid South Africa, this deliberately paced, beautifully photographed, short drama explores the legacy of small acts of racism for the post-apartheid era. A white farmer trains his puppy to hate black people using a young Xhosa boy who loves the dog, as the pawn in his lesson. Ten years later in the new South Africa, the boy, now grown, is employed as a farmhand by the farmer. One day when the two men are working together, an incident occurs where both their lives are placed at the mercy of the vicious dog, due to the cruel lesson inflicted upon it years before. Cast: Anele Vellom, Lizo C. Makambi, Danny Keogh, Terry Norton. Awards: Best Short Film and Best Original Screenplay St. Kilda Film Festival 2002.

results.title: Inheriting your physical traits
results.brief_description: Traces the inheritance of traits such as sex, eye colour, height and weight, showing the role of chromosomes and genes in determining their development. Shows the effect of dominant and recessive genes, and the results of the blending of the two.

results.title: Inherit the wind
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation and Stanley Kramer
results.brief_description: Inspired by the famous “Monkey Trial” of 1925, when a school teacher in Tennessee stood accused of teaching Darwin’s theory of evolution, this outstanding courtroom drama embodies the century old debate between Evolutionists and Creationists. The tightly woven script is highlighted by the timeless performances of Spencer Tracy and Fredric March as the defense and prosecution attorneys, Gene Kelly as the cynical, progressive reporter and Dick York as the young teacher.

results.title: Inhabitants: their activities
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Microcosms of the Mouth”.
A documentation of the discovery of an details of microcosms living in the “scum” covering our teeth. Many microscopic pictures of microcosms and lots of scientific terms used.

results.title: Ingrid Bergman: a woman of courage
results.creator_credit: Wombat Productions, Inc., Gene Feldman and Suzette Winter
results.brief_description: Ingrid Bergman, winner of three Academy Awards, was one of Hollywood’s and the world’s most beloved and respected stars. Whatever her role, be it barmaid or Joan of Arc, to millions she embodied all that was decent and wholesome in womanhood…until she dared to follow her own heart. Narrated by John Gielgud.

results.title: Ingress (2013)
results.brief_description: Ingress (or Ingress Prime) is an augmented reality (AR) mobile game developed and published by Niantic for Android and iOS devices.

constellations_other.name: Location and exploration
constellations_other.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

results.description: Welcome to the world of Ingress, Agent. The discovery of XM, a mysterious resource of unknown origin, has sparked a covert struggle between two distinct Factions.
description_for_label: Welcome to the world of Ingress, Agent. The discovery of XM, a mysterious resource of unknown origin, has sparked a covert struggle between two distinct Factions.

results.title: Ingredients of an effective speech
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking with confidence”.
‘Ingredients of a speech’ addresses speaking rate, volume, voice projection, use of light and shade and the use of pausing for delivering an effective speech.

results.title: Ingmar Bergman
results.creator_credit: Svenska filminstitutet, Stattan Hedqvist and Stig Bjorkman
results.brief_description: Ingmar Bergman is widely acknowledged by film critics as adopting an intellectual stance towards film making, as well as being one of the great directors of actors. This documentary includes clips from his films and indicates his working relationships with actors. The film also brings out the requirements involved in being a film director. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Inganarr the giant serpent
results.creator_credit: Australian National University, Educational Media Australia and Ken J. Widdowson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Aboriginal legends”.
A serpent with an enormous appetite, Inganarr, ate all the people of North Goulburn Island and then proceeded to eat the people of Arnhem Land. Fortunately Inganarr suffered from indigestion due to his gluttony and the tribespeople poured out of his mouth in droves. This helps to explain why there are people in eastern Arnhem Land but no people in western Arnhem Land. This film is also available as a compilation film entitled Aboriginal legends no. 3. Suitable for middle and upper primary level.
